<@U04TK850N>: don't go in to the custom scoping right now. I easily spent half my time trying to figure out a nice way to do proper scoping so it's best to leave for last (along with custom scope annotations). But when you get to that and learn it, it will open your eyes on the possibilities on memory management since you will have all the related dependencies in layers and choose what to exist and when. 

For example in an app I'm working on, my app component has all the singletons (so everything that will be used everywhere in the app) like a json de/serializer, a session manager, a logger and some other small stuff. Then when a user logs in, I have a user component which extends the app component and holds the heavy duty stuff like readable/writable databases, caches, etc. And then at each user-relevant screen I have a screen component which extends the user component and usually holds the presenter + the use cases related.

This just enables to take memory management to the extreme. When a user is not logged in, no RAM is taken up by caches and such and the appropriate dependencies exist _only_ in the appropriate screens and get GCed otherwise.
the best way to describe the layering is this image from the last blog posted I linked
<http://frogermcs.github.io/images/15/scopes-lifecycle.png>
You should write a blog post :open_mouth:

<@U0G4JHERF>: your approach is all wrong
what you want is for your listview to be the parent, then you populate it with child card views
in terms of containment your structure should look like this
listview -> list item -> cardview
I want to divide my Listview into multiple sections.
for that having a separate listview inside cardview for each section makes more sense .. Right ?
No
because you end up in a situation where each list wants to scroll in its own parent
what I would do (probably inelegant solution) is inside of the list item take advantage of View.GONE
to remove stuff I don’t need
makes life easier
Didn’t get…

I have a big Listview with multiple categories.. 
I want to show it as multiple sub-sections.
What approach should I use ?
As I understand the card content doesn't scroll, right?
I think the point is that it shouldn’t scroll
yeah
but it has listviews in them
or maybe I’m just not understanding the question
That’s what I’m pointing out to be the problem
listview -> list item -> listview
both lists scroll
so the better way would just be to add the things into the list Item, and remove stuff you don’t want
the outer layout is just a relativelayout
If it's just those two cards, make them static and have a scrollview

This is what I am looking for.. multiple listviews shown as cards… and then able to scroll entire wall up & down to view cards below.
don't use listviews in the cards
they scroll too
and your parent scrolls
that won't work
use a linearlayout in the cards

My listview has multiple sections.. I want to club each section in a separate card.
The listitem is the card
you have multiple cards in one list
each card carries the content that you want
If each list item has it’s own card..
how do I club multiple items in a single card ?
there are many ways to do that
you can make a layout containing all the options and just set the visibility for stuff that you don’t need to View.GONE
you can set the content of the card to a simple linear layout and programatically add stuff you want
